abstract: Regulators were worried that should the value of European debt backing MF Global's repurchase transactions collapse, the firm would need to post more money quickly to cover the trade.
snippet: Regulators were worried that should the value of European debt backing MF Global's repurchase transactions collapse, the firm would need to post more money quickly to cover the trade.
lead_paragraph: MF Global, the commodities and derivatives brokerage house headed by Jon S. Corzine, the former Goldman Sachs chief and former Democratic governor and senator from New Jersey, was forced to set aside additional capital in August after regulators grew concerned about the firm's exposure to European sovereign debt.

headline.main: MF Global Ordered to Increase Capital
